description: Located in Toronto on the edge of Lake Ontario since 1985, the Harbourfront Canoe & Kayak Centre is one of the most popular urban paddling Centres in North America for kayaking, canoeing, and stand up paddleboarding. Our Lakeside Office is open daily from June to September (weather permitting) and located directly south of the Rogers Centre/CN Tower and within walking distance of many great restaurants. Come learn to canoe, kayak, and stand up paddleboard with one of our certified friendly instructors. If you already have paddling skills, rent to explore the harbour and islands on your own. Embark on a guided Tandem Kayak Tour or Big Voyageur Canoe excursion to get the best views of Toronto from the water. We are your source for connecting you to Toronto's waterfront and Islands, for relaxation, to learn new skills and to increase your health and well-being.

reviews.title: Scavenger Hunt - weird power hungry staff
text: I did the Scavenger Hunt on the Toronto islands as part of a work team event. Overall takeaways:
- there is a lot of tasks to do in the first zone, but not enough in the later ones
- they tell you you can start in any island, but the plan is actually very sequential and ideally starts at center island

- the tasks where very subjective and not specific enough, for example there was a task to write what a certain statue is looking at. The statue can be seen looking at a boat, the city, the CN tower, or really anything in front of it. But there is only one right answer!
- they try to incentivize you to not get a bike for “500 points” even though the bike rental is included in the price of the ticket

- the person who was running the show was really rude and socially inept. He went on this weird power trip ducking points away from teams for weird reasons (e.g. taking points away for not “listening” to him or making him repeat himself. Taking points away for being asked simple questions about the event.) when I challenged him on the arbitrary point system he snapped and accused me of “demeaning” the judges.

- after we were done we were eager to get our scores and hear the results, but the organizer asked us to leave and said he would text us the score later. Kind of defeating the excitement and purpose of us being together for this event
Great idea, terrible execution and shady business practices. Lookup other scavenger hunts on the island and take your money elsewhere!

reviews.title: super accomodating
text: Excellent Prompt service for both in person & online. I dropped in one day, owner Dave approached me and exceeded all expectations. Result i now store kayak there. HAPPY.

reviews.title: Kayaking during Covid
text: Some of my fellow dragon boaters & I have been hungering (thirsting?) for some on-water experience this gloomy yet glorious shut-down summer.  Eight of us booked Harbourfront Centre's sunset tour.  What a great evening!  2.5 hours of paddling, learning new skills, seeing the Islands and the waterfront from a new perspective, experiencing a harbour crossing, getting new information and history, and getting some exercise.  A much more interesting and instructive outing than I was expecting, and better equipment, too.  James was our delightful and enthusiastic guide.

reviews.title: Good hour
text: its a nice was to look at Toronto . Just pick a calm day to enjoy a good morning. Bring a coffee or tea

reviews.title: Bucket List Kayaking Experience
text: Did this with three of my teenage/adult kids, we took out two tandem kayaks. Our guide Jimmy was an awesome 73 year old with a six pack to die for, gained via years of kayaking.  Everything was well explained and as a total beginner I felt safe and well supported.  We kayaked over to the Toronto Islands, paddled around them, saw some amazing wildlife like turtles, Cormorants, Herons, and then came back to the mainland. I think that final stretch, with the Toronto skyline ahead of me and planes flying overhead, was one of the most amazing things I've ever done. And I've done a lot! I highly recommend this, worth every penny.

reviews.title: Totally different way to experience Toronto
text: These folks are amazing, fun but safety first, rent kayaks and canoes paddle around the harbour on your own, or with a group on a social paddle. Learn about the harbour, meet new folks, make friends, learn to paddle or improve your skills.  Boats are clean and well maintained.

reviews.title: Great Instructor and Team
text: I cannot ask for a better instructor than Cheryl.  It was my very first kayaking session and I knew nothing about kayaking. Cheryl explains everything in such a logical way that it was easy for me to understand.  Her best character is her ability to break down someone’s worry and fear and make them go away. Most people, including me, has fear of flipping over. In the beginning we got over that by her telling me what to do when that happens and explanation about how stable the kayak is. After that I could relax and really focus on learning the skills.  We learned quite a few things in our 3.5 hour session. I probably am not ready for a big trip yet, but I definitely got hooked.

reviews.title: Kayak Training
text: An amazing experience! The training and the instructors were fantastic. I came to do kayak instruction and water rescue, we did training at various locations of the waterfront and at Center island. They supply all the equipment, I stayed close by at a local hotel. The hotel was pricey but the training cost was reasonable. A fantastic week! Highly recommended for anyone who wants or needs instruction for canoe and kayak.

reviews.title: Build Skills: Kayak Lesson
text: If you want to learn how to canoe or kayak, this place is a great option to build your skills and your confidence. I attended an Introduction Day 1 beginners' class that ran from 10 AM to 4 PM and was very happy I did.

The other class attendees were friendly and our instructor that day (Eric) is a skilled and highly experienced teacher who is friendly, patient, and safety focused. We covered the basics in the morning, took a lunch break, then went back out on the lake for a tour through Toronto Island canals that feature wildlife areas. At each stage Eric confirmed that all attendees were comfortable with what they had learned and felt ready to advance to the next step before proceeding.

Paddling in Toronto Harbour is a beautiful vantage point to see the Toronto skyline, while learning how to navigate a high traffic area (you will be sharing the water with power boats, water taxis, ferries, etc., so it really builds your awareness). Overall I recommend it as a fun day out - bring plenty of drinking water and a waterproof bag for your kit because you will take on some water!

reviews.title: Outstanding customer servide
text: We arrived late for our trip due to unforeseen circumstances. Richard was amazing and offered us a great alternative. My Belgium friends had a great visit due to his outstanding service. We will be back!  Thank you Richard.

reviews.title: great way to spend an evening
text: Wonderful time with friends seeing the city of toronto from the water.  Invite friends to join you, you will not be disappoint

reviews.title: Fun Times
text: I do the evening social paddle every summer and have had an awesome time!  Grab a bunch of friends and head down for a quick paddle and a BBQ!

reviews.title: Amazing tour of the Toronto Islands
text: Had a great evening in the Toronto Islands during the 3 hours tandem kayak tour. Our guide Richard was very helpful. This was my first kayak experience and will not be the last. Thank you again guys!!!!

reviews.title: A definite 'Must Do' whilst in Toronto
text: We had booked 2 nights in the Radissin Admiral Hotel  in Toronto and wanted to do something out of the norm whilst in the city. We spotted the Canoe Centre whist doing research on the. Hotel and it's location in the city. We popped our head in he office and was greeted by a young male behind the desk who was very police and friendly. He discussed all our options available, enquiring as to our previous experience in either a kayak or open Canoe. We chose to take the evening 3 hr excursion on a guided Kayak tour of the small islands and bird sanctuary in Toronto Harbour. We arrived in plenty of time and where we met our Irish tour guide who was very friendly. He assisted with kitting us out with a double canoe and and sizing our paddles correctly. We where joined by two other couples. After a short but sweet safety brief and a few pointers on how to paddle a kayak we headed out into the bay.  The weather had turned for the worse so the instructor offered us the opportunity to head back in and get a full refund which we all declined and continued on our voyage of discovery. Once across the bay we entered the Island Channels and began to explore. The instructor was very knowledgable about the area and gave us a full history lesson as we paddled pointing out points of interest and identifying the local wildlife. Again the weather looked like it was coming in so the instructor radioed to the main office for an up to date weather report taking in consideration for our general safety and also enjoyment. The weather wasn't as bad as first thought so we continued onward deeper into the inlets and waterways which all seemed very calm and peaceful apart from the odd boat wizzing past. We stayed out for over 2 hours which included a ' comfort break ' . We arrived back at the shore at dusk, unfortunately it was cloudy but on a sunny evening would have experienced a spectacular sunset over the city who's magnificent skyline was always in the distance whist we paddled but so much added to the experience.
In all we had a wonderful experience and would recommend it to anybody wanting to do something a little different whist visiting Toronto.

reviews.title: Big surprise during the paddle
text: My cousin and I wanted to have some outdoor activities during our stay in Toronto. So we ended up booking the Sunrise tour for 2 1/2h. Paddling to the island and crossing the channel was quiet fun and whatching the trees along the shore go by was lovely to see. After 20min paddling, we suddenly  stopped and were told we have an hour on Central Island now. We were both so much disappointed in that since we booked the trip for paddling only. We know the island just nor waterfront-wise. That actually has been a huge disappointment and has altered our excitment for canoeing. Especially, they haven't mentioned such a long stay on their website.
Nevertheless, we ended up paddling through some channels and a bit more than what was originally planned, which was nice and they really valued our feedback.
Overall, it's been a great experience! Just make sure you won't be surprised

reviews.title: Voyageur Canoe Ride - Not a Guided Tour!!
text: My husband and I booked in for a Voyageur Canoe Ride on a Sunday afternoon.
First off, I was quite disappointed that we did not end up going in the actual classic voyageur canoe because there was not enough people...

But, probably most disappointing was the tour guide...or actually lack of a tour guide. This tour is marketed as a 'guided tour'...and honestly there was absolutely nothing guided about it. The guide hardly spoke, had a couple of things to say about the elementary school on the island as we approached, but he seemed very unsure about all the facts he was saying....he hardly spoke at all, all he did was steer.

He did not talk about or visit any "bird sanctuaries" or "lagoons", if we did visit them, I did not know we did. He also mentioned hardly anything about the history of the island and it's 13 Island Archipelago...
During the midway break, he just set us off on our way with no information about what was around or what there was to do.
Although it is an incredible way to see the Islands, I would never recommend this trip to anyone else....

reviews.title: Such fun - best way to see the islands
text: We rented a tandem kayak for the day and paddled over the bay and around the islands. It was a fantastic day and the kayak was the perfect way to see this amazing bit of Toronto.
Assuming you know the basics of paddling and are confident on the water the lake area around Toronto seems pretty safe and we were provided with a map and some friendly advice to get us on our way.

The islands themselves are fairly busy but being on a kayak you can visit all the little secluded lagoons and bays away from the crowds. There's loads of opportunity to moor up and grab some food and drink at one of the bars or restaurants or equally pull up on a quiet beach and have a picnic all on your own.
Brilliant day out!

reviews.title: Excellent way to see Toronto Islands
text: The Harbourfront Canoe & Kayak Centre offers a variety of water options from Canoes to stand up boarding.

I was able to participate with a group on a complementary canoe tour of Toronto Islands.  The length and breadth of the tour depends on your group in how fast they can paddle and how much time they want to spend in areas.  I've done some amerature racing in canoes similar to the ones used so understood a little bit about group rowing.  The guide didn't bother trying to get the group into a cadence just let them figure out whats best.  So the coordinated effort of the group suffered a little, but we still saw plenty.

Crossing the harbour gives you great views of landing plains at the airport.  Once you're in the islands you will feel completed separated from the city as if you're in a far away nature preserve.  Very relaxing.
And tiring.
The weather wasn't perfect as it was a little windy which made the harbour crossing part requiring a bit more work.

reviews.title: Despite the guide, we had a great time.
text: I took the sunset canoe trip in the voyageur canoe. This was a no experience needed guided trip. Once everyone arrived the guide came over for our safety and instruction talk. It was literately "Grab a vest and paddle and follow me." Once we all got in the canoe, the guide just said to paddle backwards, everyone paddled in a different direction. Having been given no instructions it took a bit before we were on the move.

The actually canoe ride was wonderful. This was our first time in Toronto and it was great seeing such a lovely place so close to the city. Luckily I had read about the area before hand because our guide did not tell us any info about the area.

On our break, we were promised hot chocolate, but received lemonade. No big deal, but the lemonade was not very good. We were told noting about the area we stopped at, but we enjoyed our walk on the beach. When it was time to go, everyone was near the canoe just milling around waiting for instruction. The guide had his vest on looking ready to go, so I went over and put mine on, everyone else followed. If I had not done so, there is no telling how long we all would have just sat there waiting for direction.
The views on the paddle back were wonderful and just the reason I wanted to do the trip. We saw the city skyline as the sun was setting and the peaceful islands behind us.
Overall it was a great time, I just wish the guide would have done something other than steer the boat.

reviews.title: Have been coming down every week for years
text: I cannot wait for wetsuit season to be over and the official kayaking season to begin.
I discovered Dave and this group several years ago when my husband died suddenly and I found myself without a paddling partner.
I originally got hooked on the social paddles and last year progressed to a few intermediate paddles, which were quite awesome.
The group is wonderful--one sees many of the same faces each season.
Forty or fifty kayaks and a stray canoe or two head out in a pack for the Toronto Islands around six or six thirty pm depending upon the time of year, past the sailboats and ferries.
They paddle around the islands for an hour or so.
Some stop for a while in the bird sanctuary and some head off for maneuvers through branch choked narrow passages.
The scenery is stunning. There are herons and night herons, cormorans and other birds and we once spotted a mink.
Returning to the Harbourfront as the sun is ducking behind the clouds, sun magically glinting on the water, and the purple lights blinking on to illuminate the Rogers Center is magical.
The equipment is top of the line.
There is generally a barbecue after the social paddles where everyone winds down.
The center also has group and individual rentals and offers lessons.
TIP--buy a book of tickets for the season and get coupons for reduced parking at the lot across the street. Bring suntan lotion and plenty to drink.
I generally drive down early, to avoid rush hour, and pack a picnic to enjoy at the waters edge before the group gets started.
There are bathrooms--the center could seriously use some changing rooms.

reviews.title: Great day outfitters
text: This company is great! As an experienced canoe paddler, they are safety conscious and had me do a test paddle of their slip area to get comfortable with abilities. Laminated map to help navigate through the islands, warned of dangerous areas to avoid, checked for sunscreen & bottled water on a hot day. I was surprised there was no tow line nor whistle included in the rental (but didn't need it). Renting a canoe is best done with reservations made on line, as these folks get busy!  Note the canoe rental rate on Centre island is $40 more expensive. Worth the paddle over on your own muscle!  Its really not that far.

reviews.title: Good & friendly service, easy access to the water
text: Good & friendly service, easy access to the water. We were able to rent sup boards quickly and be out in the water within 10 minutes. It was a beautiful experience to sup on the lake and see the skyscrapers and downtown Toronto area in the background. Would definitely recommend if you have the time to do sup or kayak.

reviews.title: Anniversary gift
text: Our kids gave us the day to kayak as a gift for our anniversary. Our day was windless and overcast so the paddle across Lake Ontario to the islands was beautiful. Watching the airplanes come in to land right over our head was quite the experience. Loved the "seal" launch to get out in the open water from the dock area. Staff was courteous and knowledgeable. A great place to enjoy the water.

reviews.title: The Only Canoe & Kayak Centre to join
text: This is the best place I have ever seen to store your canoe or kayak and it is run by the nicest people you could ever meet.  Dave is one gentleman.  Great learning classes as well as great socials.  A great place to spend the summer for City dwellers.

reviews.title: Great experience!
text: I took a weekend course and it was a great experience. Our instructor, Michael, was wonderful - patient, supportive, and very informative. Everyone else, from the office staff to the dock crew, were friendly and helpful. Paddling around the islands was a unique experience and although I've visited before, it was a totally different perspective. I would definitely recommend Harbourfront Canoe and Kayak for courses or rentals.

reviews.title: Great city-side SUPing
text: Firstly, the office aren't helpful at all and seem as though they have no idea what they're doing BUT, smile and carry on, the dock side guys are relaxed and trust you, if you're experienced they won't question it, if not, they'll be happy to help.

You're allowed paddle across the harbour (or you may take a shuttle boat if you're not feeling up to it) and out to the island water ways, which is extremely chill and then on the way back you're looking straight at the beautiful Toronto skyline the whole way.
It only cost $50 for 3 hours and we got there early enough (11:00am) that we didn't need to book our place, great experience, I'd highly recommend it.

reviews.title: Great Family Fun and Informative Tour of Toronto Islands
text: This was a fun, safe and informative canoe trip from Harbourfront to The Toronto Islands. Basic canoeing and safety lessons were given. We paddled across the channel to middle island in a voyager canoe accompanied by an informed guide that provided the steering, the passengers the paddling power. There were stops in bird sanctuaries and on middle island. We spent approx 2.5 hrs on the canoe tour and it was well worth it. An interesting perspective and mode of travel that harkened back to the time when the native and Metis voyagers travelled by canoe. Well worth the money spent!

reviews.title: 43 Friends!
text: Organized 43 of us to do an evening paddle through the islands and back at sunset.  43 Happy People who had a great time together.  The staff were fun and taught us a lot about the history around the islands from Hanlans Point, Bird Sanctuary to the history of the Island church and even about the Toronto Skyline that we didn't know before.

reviews.title: Relaxing!!
text: Loved this experience. A nice break from the city to chill out for a while. Also the views are incredible from the harbour!

reviews.title: One of my most memorable paddling experiences!
text: I rented a kayak for 3-4 hours while on a visit to Toronto. The staff helped me pick out the right kayak and made sure I could control it correctly before they sent me out there. It's pretty exiting to cross over an expanse of lake to the Toronto Islands, there is lots of traffic and it might be intimidating to a beginner. I'm used to the Mississippi River, which is as wide in spots with bigger boats and a swift current to boot, so it was fun for me. Once you get to the islands, it's a quieter experience. It's great fun to explore around and if you like birds there are plenty. And you can't beat the views of the city from the islands, absolutely gorgeous. They give you a helpful waterproof map to take along so you can find your way around and even an out-of-towner can feel comfortable.

reviews.title: Great Location Good Day For All
text: Harborfront Canoe and Kayak is ideally located for a great paddle around the harbour and the islands. Make sure you bring sunscreen, baseball cap and a sense of adventure and you are sure to have fun. Looking forward to a great 2018 season.

reviews.title: Great experience!
text: I've now paddled with three of their instructors and all are fantastic! They make the day so fun, they are very knowledgeable, and safety-conscious. I recommend them highly for lessons!

reviews.title: Beautiful way to spend a morning
text: We saw these guys down on harbourfront on a previous visit, and thought it would be a great thing to do in the heart of the city.

The website worked fine for our reservation. When we showed up, the staff were fun and very helpful. We are experienced paddlers, so we just did a single rental for each of us. Nice trip out to the island and back. Power boaters were surprisingly respectful of keeping their distance, and reducing speed. You get such an amazing view of the city from the water.
Thanks guys, we had a great time!

reviews.title: Great experience
text: We rented a canoe with some friends from Harbourfront to the Island. Good & friendly service. It was a beautiful experience to see the skyscrapers and downtown Toronto area in the background. Would definitely recommend it.

reviews.title: Greatest experience in Toronto
text: Paddling and kayaking from the Harbourfront five you unique perspectives of the Toronto skyline.  You see planes, sails, kayak, water taxis... the sky is always interesting and the cherry on the cake is walking on the islands with ducks and swans.  You feel at the same tome very far from the noise of the city and at the same time you appreciate th beauty of the buildings.

reviews.title: Great time
text: Did a group kayak tour along Toronto harbourfront and the islands. Amazing experience that included breathtaking views of the Toronto skyline. Each kayak can fit up to 16 ppl and it is a leisurely paddle which enjoying the amazing views. Last about 2.5 hours.

reviews.title: Came here to have a good time only to be mocked at
text: My friend and I came here on a lovely Sunday afternoon very excited to kayak around lake Ontario. I've kayaked a couple times before and it would have been my friends first kayaking experience, so needless to say, we were both looking forward to this day.

We had made reservations for the 2 person Tandem kayak which was noted on the website for individuals with no experience. Also on the website noted that we would have to pass a paddling assessment (this makes sense considering the harbour is a very busy channel). Upon arrival, reception and getting our life jackets and equipment went smoothly until we took our paddling assessment.

This was my friends first time kayaking so we had a rocky start in the assessment with the turning and maneuvering. After a couple tries, the man who was assessing us did not give us the green light to go out into the harbour.

We were totally understandable of this because we do not want our lives nor other peoples lives in danger and the man was simply doing his job. HOWEVER, the man who was assessing us was quite rude. He mocked us throughout the assessment, laughing and jeering at us as if he expected us to paddle like professionals. Not only was this embarrassing, he was very unprofessional.

It is one thing to do your job and it is another to harass your customers. We came here to have a good time and it was ruined for us. It's quite unfortunate and disappointing that we had this experience.

reviews.title: Must do!!!
text: We hired a tandem kayak for two hours. It was the best two hours of our holiday. We dodged the white buoys (fines zones) and aimed straight for the islands.
We had hope to hire the kayak on the island but it was closed the day we visited.
Friendly helpful staff and such an exclusive way to explore Toronto. And the skyline.... WOW

reviews.title: Serene experience!
text: The people manning this centre are really open hearted, generous and know their stuff. Loved everything about my experience with them. It's wonderful to know the history (away from the cruise ships), do some exercise as well as get to see the islands' unreachable by foot places and the swamps!!

reviews.title: A Must-do in Toronto - For Those Who Love the Water!
text: My friend was visiting from New York city and he is an outdoors enthusiast. We pre-booked the tandem kayaks 3 days in advance because they tend to book up fast in the summer. The price for 2 hrs on the water with views of the city and islands is hard to beat! The Kayak centre is very well organized and they help you into your kayak and provide life jackets and a basic explanation of the areas of the harbour to avoid. We paddled over to the islands in about 20 minutes and then explored the channels and smaller islands, including a place called "Doughnut" island because its hollow in the center and water filled. Saw lots of geese and even a rare Blue Heron. We took a short break on the islands and my friend had a swim! The water this time of year is warm. If you are careful you can take some photos from the kayak, just be careful not to drop your cell phone! A money belt is advisable, and swim suit because your clothes eventually get wet. This was a most memorable time on the water, and something you don't get to try everyday!
